meanings.definition: To stop using something as currency.
meanings.sent1: The small island decided to demonetize their old coins and use seashells instead.
meanings.sent2: The government chose to demonetize the old paper money to introduce a new digital currency.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank started a protest when the kids tried to demonetize their favorite coin.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to demonetize her collection of rare stamps shocked the philately community.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell seemed to demonetize the gold coins, turning them into leaves.

meanings.definition: To remove the monetary value from something.
meanings.sent1: The company had to demonetize the damaged products before selling them at a discount.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to demonetize her artwork by giving it away for free.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun tried to demonetize the chocolate coins by painting them silver.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis seemed to demonetize the entire stock market overnight.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion had the power to demonetize any precious gemstone into a common pebble.

meanings.definition: To render something no longer valid as legal tender.
meanings.sent1: The counterfeit bills were so well-made that they could easily demonetize the real currency.
meanings.sent2: The ancient law sought to demonetize certain coins to prevent counterfeiting.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's plan to demonetize the vending machine tokens backfired when they got stuck inside.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected announcement to demonetize the old banknotes caused chaos in the market.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious artifact had the power to demonetize any currency placed near it.
